meanings.definition: A small, rocky hill or mound.
meanings.sent1: The children climbed the scog to get a better view of the playground.
meanings.sent2: The hikers enjoyed the view from the top of the scog.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous squirrel made its home in the cozy crevices of the scog.
meanings.sent4: The scog stood like a tiny guardian overlooking the valley below.
meanings.sent5: The scog's rough surface made it a challenging but rewarding climb.

meanings.definition: To move or travel quickly and with determination.
meanings.sent1: She had to scog through the crowd to catch the bus on time.
meanings.sent2: The athlete scogged towards the finish line, determined to win the race.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel scogged across the yard to hide its acorn stash.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to scog by as they raced against the setting sun.
meanings.sent5: The river scogged through the valley, carving its path with determination.

meanings.definition: A dense growth of shrubs or small trees.
meanings.sent1: The forest was filled with a scog of bushes and saplings.
meanings.sent2: The birds nested within the protective cover of the scog.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous rabbits played hide-and-seek in the tangled scog.
meanings.sent4: The scog of greenery provided a natural barrier against the harsh winds.
meanings.sent5: The scog teemed with life, from insects to small mammals.
